question: What are the names of mentioned capital improvement projects?

Subject:

Capital Improvement Projects and Disaster Recovery Projects Status
Report

RECOMMENDED ACTION: Receive and file report on the status of the City’s current and
upcoming Capital Improvements Projects and Disaster Recovery Projects.

DISCUSSION: Staff will provide a status update on the following active projects in the
Fiscal Year 2020-2021 Capital Improvement Program:

Capital Improvement Projects (Design)

Marie Canyon Green Streets
(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) The City has recently received Measure W funds to complete this

bidding.

(cid:190) Project Schedule:

maintenance of City streets.

(cid:131) Complete Design: Spring 2021

Capital Improvement Projects (Construction)

City Hall Roof Replacement

(cid:190) Updates: City staff continues to review project related material submittals.
Once submittals are approved, all materials will be ordered and shipped to
the project site. The roof ISO board membrane is on back order due to the
recent storms in Texas which halted manufacturing. The estimated material
arrival and start date is the middle of May.
(cid:190) Project Schedule: May 2021 through July 2021

Bluffs Park Workout Station

(cid:190) Updates: The contractor has completed and installed all the new workout
equipment and rubber surfacing. Remaining work includes punch list items
only.

(cid:190) Project Schedule: Estimated completion date is April 2021.

Civic Center Way Improvements

(cid:190) Updates:

Civic Center Way Improvements

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) Work Hours: Monday through Friday 7:00AM to 4:00PM, Saturdays

7:00AM to 4:00PM

(cid:131) Civic Center Way was reopened to the public on April 8th. While being
open, many project related items will continue. This will include
intermittent traffic control (lane closures). The remaining items includes
final paving, striping, irrigation, painting, planting material, clean-up,
and final detailing.

(cid:190) Project Schedule: August 2020 through April 2021

Birdview Avenue Improvements (CalOES Project)

(cid:190) Updates:

Outdoor Warning Sirens (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Updates: This project will be funded through a grant from FEMA after the
Wooley Fire. The project consists of hiring a consultant to develop a plan that
includes the evaluation of a siren system and possible locations. Staff is
working on an RFQ to hire a consultant for the design.

(cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Unknown
